Issue Title: Position (width) of Preview inside entry editor not remembered
Issue Body:
### JabRef version Latest development branch build (please note build date below) Issue was mentioned in the forum thread https://discourse.jabref.org/t/inability-of-jabref-to-restore-preferences-after-a-version-update/4296/3 ### Operating system macOS ### Details on version and operating system _No response_ ### Checked with the latest development build (copy version output from About dialog) - [X] I made a backup of my libraries before testing the latest development version. - [X] I have tested the latest development version and the problem persists ### Steps to reproduce the behaviour 1. Open the entry editor 2. Adjust the preview window position on the right, e.g. reduce the width 3. Close JabRef and restart => The window position is reset Step 2: After restarting JabRef Implementation details: The EntryEditorPreferences need to be enhanced with a new Property for the Preview Position, similar to how it's done for the divider position which remembers the height. ### Appendix ...
Log File ``` Paste an excerpt of your log file here ```

Issue Title: Selected group loses focus after paste doi
Issue Body:
JabRef 5.14--2024-04-30--4f87740
Windows 11 10.0 amd64 
Java 21.0.2 
JavaFX 22.0.1+7

### Checked with the latest development build (copy version output from About dialog)

- [X] I made a backup of my libraries before testing the latest development version.
- [X] I have tested the latest development version and the problem persists

### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

1. Select a group
2. Copy a doi from somewhere 
3. Click anywhere in the table and paste, jabref will correctly create a new entry with the selected group assigned
4. Copy another doi from somewhere
5. Click anywhere in the table and paste, jabref will create a new entry but not assigned to the group. In fact it will not show up in "all entries" immediately, and one needs to click a few random groups back and forth, until that works. But still, the new entry is not assigned to the group that was selected first.

Note: 
This is related to issue #8933, it seems that after the first copy-paste in both instances, the group is somehow "deselected", even though it is still shown as selected.
Issue  #11085 might be related too
Comment Bodies:
Thanks for the report, will be fixed by https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/pull/11271|SEPARATOR|Great thanks a lot! Does it fix issue #8933 too?|SEPARATOR|You can test this version https://builds.jabref.org/pull/11271/merge

I will test the other issue as well but I think it was the same underlying cause |SEPARATOR|I just tried it and can confirm that it fixes all three related issues #8933, #11271 and #11085! Thanks again.|SEPARATOR|
PR Body:
Fixes #11085 
Fixes #11269
Fixes #8933
